Articles.Content:
Using any part and any flight aid except cheats (as in, no infinite fuel, etc), launch two manned capsules into two Kerbol orbits, one carrying one crew member inside Kerbal's orbit and one outside which has one crew member and space for one more. With the INNER orbiting craft, make a close flyby rendezvous (NOT a docking manoeuvre) and perform a free flight EVA transfer of one crew member to the other craft and return that craft to Kerbin.

(I know this can be done, I did it as an impromptu rescue during a failed Duna/Ike mission and it was *bloody hard*).

Rules/scoring:

No infinite fuel/infinite RCS

No refueling

Mission scores as a success or as a failure depending on safe landing of both Kerbals back on Kerbin. Usual proof rules apply.

Mission profile:

1. Launch low orbit one-man manned probe into Kerbol orbit.

2. Launch high orbit two-man manned probe into Kerbol orbit.

3. Plan and execute Holmann transfer in one-man probe to high orbit and rendezvous.

4. Execute EVA transfer from one-man probe to two-man probe.

5. Return two-man probe to Kerbin SOI and soft ground landing.

Extra "Kudos" points for landing within sight of KSC!

**Fuel consumption is a definite issue in this one, as I had no way to refuel either craft! Appending the rules to reflect this slight inconvenience**

Not sure what part of the challenge you guys are missing.

Two craft in Sol orbit, one higher then Kerbal one lower, rendezvous and transfer crew and return to Kerbin.

Measured by total fuel use, so efficiency of crafts is taken into account.

To give you an idea of what the OP is talking about:

If you have seen Gravity, then you know the bit where Sandra Bullock jumps out of her soyuz capsule and grabs onto Tiangong without decelerating the capsule, and instead using a fire extinguisher to do so after exiting.

The challenge is to re-enact this scene, except to have one ship at a higher orbit, another at a lower orbit, and make an encounter with it, then jump out and board the second vessel using only your EVA pack.
